page.title: 151985 Trout Fishing Season
page.content: The season is 2nd April-15th October. The poor summer made conditions difficult and although the total (including the Barrows) of over 40,000 is satisfactory there is no chance that the Bristol Waterworks Company's record catch total of 45,976, set in 1982, will be broken. Unfortunately, only 64% of anglers send in their catch records which prevents the Company producing a true picture of the catch. Some good-sized fish have been caught, many between 5 - 10 lbs and some over 12 lbs. Generally speaking, the boat fishermen have been more successful than bank fishermen though limit bags have been recorded by both. A party from Leicester during 3 days' boat fishing on the Chew Valley netted 47 trout weighing 129 lb 14oz. A fisherman from each lake has qualified in Troutmaster 1985.
